label: Room 40
description:
A long overdue, first comprehensive edition of Black Rain's moody 1994 soundtrack to Neuromancer, perfectly matching William Gibson's prophetic sci-fi vision through neon-lit, grimy material from Ike Yard's Stuart Argabright and his Death Comet Crew cohort Shinichi Shimokawa.

The soundtrack to a 1994 audiobook version of William Gibson’s cyberspace prophecy, ’Neuromancer’ is finally unveiled on the novel’s 40th anniversary after parts of it were previously manifested on Blackest Ever... more

label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Producer, designer, publisher, filmmaker, all-round scene phenom - Lasse Marhaug returns with his first album since relocating from Oslo to the Arctic Circle, surveying his 35-year career for a set of grizzled, doom-pocked rhythms and foghorn drones pulled from the aether. Expansive and hard to categorise, it's a precision-tooled set of ice-cold tonal productions that heavily lean into Mika Vainio’s rhythm experiments, with extra levels of growling bass and curious noises to send us deep into the... more

title_full:
Valerio Tricoli & Hanno Leichtmann

              —
              Cinnte Le Dia
            
              (NI VU NI CONNU)
label: NI VU NI CONNU
description:
Revox tape machine virtuoso Valerio Tricoli meets Hanno Liechtmann’s tightly dextrous rhythm section in a suite of concrète technoid dervishes after two aces for the dearly departed Entr’acte label.

The man-machine duo reprise inimitably uncanny energies blending reactive live improvisations with subtle post-edit stitching that mess with the grid as they appear to move amorphous objects in abstracted space-time. This one feels as though they’re even more finely attuned to each other’s... more

title_full:
de' Lamperi

            —
            Addio esseri di polvere

Jessica Pratt

              —
              Here in the Pitch
            
              (City Slang)
label: City Slang
description:
Jessica Pratt fleshes out the bare-boned folk of her previous records on 'Here in the Pitch', sculpting dimly lit Californian memories into tape-saturated, pseudo-hauntological vignettes and sounding almost like Broadcast if they'd been brought up on a diet of The Beach Boys, The Walker Brothers, Burt Bacharach and Van Dyke Parks. Utterly brilliant stuff - Pratt's most satisfying album yet.

Pratt's always been good, but 'Here in the Pitch' is an unexpected and perfectly realised left turn... more

label: 3XL
description:
Pent ventures a debut statement of crisp and aerated ambient electronica and post-club diffusions via shy’s 3XL nexus - one for fans of Kindohm, Perko, Kakuhan.

On ‘Trepidation Cycles’ Pent trades in a style of shearing sound design and displaced rhythmic syntax primed for listeners who like it abstract but just about yoked back from all out oddness. We can tell you bot all about their background, but the music speaks on its own merits with a keen exploration of im/possible physics perfused... more

release: Magister Perotinus Meets The Jedi Masters
title_full:
Roberto Laneri

            —
            Magister Perotinus Meets The Jedi Masters

label: Line
description:
Lumisokea's Koenraad Ecker reworks three multi-channel studies on 'Raw Materials', using dense environmental recordings, close mic-ed, foley crunches and unsettling drones to put his own signature on electro-acoustic/concrète music.

It's been a while since we last heard from Ecker. His last solo album 'A Biology of Shadows' appeared back in 2018, and 'Raw Materials' fills in the gaps, collecting work he wrote between 2018 and 2020. 'Transparent Bodies, Submarine Roots'... more
